parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To notify, command, charge, entreat solemnly. From para and the base of aggelos; to transmit a message, i.e. to enjoin.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.
(including the other inflections); from toi and houtos; truly this, i.e. Of this sort (to denote character or individuality).
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To work, trade, perform, do, practice, commit, acquire by labor.
Quietness, stillness, silence. Feminine of hesuchios; stillness, i.e. Desistance from bustle or language.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Strengthened for a primary edo; used only in certain tenses, the rest being supplied by phago; to eat.
